title: Why is the Sky Blue?
text:
The sky appears blue because of a phenomenon called Rayleigh scattering.
\[I = I_0 \frac{8\pi^4\alpha^2}{\lambda^4 R^2} (1 + \cos^2 \theta)\]
As light passes through the atmosphere, shorter wavelengths (blue) scatter more than longer wavelengths (red).

title: The Physics of Fiber Optics
text:
Fiber optics work by trapping light inside a glass core using Total Internal Reflection.— title: “The Physics of Fiber Optics” description: “Understanding how total internal reflection enables high-speed data transmission.” date: 2026-01-11 categories: [Technology, Optics] image: fiber.jpg —

0.1 Introduction
Fiber optics rely on the principle of Total Internal Reflection. When light hits a boundary at an angle larger than the critical angle, it reflects back entirely into the medium.
\[\theta_c = \arcsin\left(\frac{n_2}{n_1}\right)\]


0.2 Why it Matters
This allows data to travel thousands of miles with minimal signal loss.
